title: Eliminate a Variable
text: Elimintate the y's by multiplying the first equation by 2. $$2\left(3x-y\right)=2\left(-7\right)$$ $$4x+2y=-6$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. y will be eliminated and then solve for x. $$10x=-20$$ $$x=-2$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$x=-2$$ into the first equation, $$3x-y=-7$$. Then solve for y. $$3x-y=-7$$ $$3\left(-2\right)-y=-7$$ $$-6-y=-7$$ $$-y=-1$$ $$y=1$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (-2,1).
